title: Succession 2019 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is a blend of Quintessence, Candy Mountain and Ancient Stones vineyard fruit. The aromas are subdued and primary, with notes of flower, plum, ash and herb, along with whiffs of black pepper. The palate is all primary fruit, dipping in the middle before coming back together on the finish.

title: Tenuta del Pajaru 2019 Picuraru Organic Primitivo (Puglia)
description: A dense, brambly nose of dark cherry and blackberry aromas meets lifted elements of crushed black pepper and potpourri spice. It's plush and supple in feel, yet there's ample power behind all the rich berry tones thanks to lasting, fresh acidity.

title: Vetrère 2018 Tempio di Giano Negroamaro (Salento)
description: This red smartly matches intense brambleberry fruit with anise and orange peel accents. It's plump and pleasantly rounded on the palate, wrapped in velvety tannins and bright acidity for support.

title: Vigna di Pettineo 2019 Superiore Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Aromas of French oak, mature pear and eucalyptus form the nose. Made with organically cultivated grapes, the linear, vibrant palate offers crushed wild herbs, grapefruit, vanilla and a hint of butterscotch before closing on a note of salted almond.

title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2019 Elégante  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: Matured in tank to preserve the fruit, this wine is bright and smoky. Perfumed with floral blackberry fruits, the spicy wine will be ready to drink from 2022.

title: Silhouette 2017 Cuvée 211 Reserve Red (North Coast)
description: Both aromatic and quite rich on the palate, this big but smooth wine is saturated in plump blackberry, ripe plum and dried fig flavors. It is mouthfilling, only slightly tannic and has a fruity generosity that lasts through the finish.
